Metro Area', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'company': 'The World Bank', 'description': 'Transport, Energy and Mining Sector; East Asia/Pacific Region

Was responsible for the socio-environmental aspects of rural electrification projects in Loa PDR, Cambodia, Solomon Islands, Tonga, Samoa, and Vanuatu. My responsibilities included supervision of the social and environmental safeguard requirements during project preparation, implementation and completion, safeguards capacity building, and involvement in components related to i.e. indigenous people and gender. I regularly visited project countries and sites. 

Projects: 
Lao PDR Rural Electrification Projects (REP) 
•	Supervised the government's compliance with safeguard requirements. 
•	Provided capacity building and technical assistance to government agencies on safeguards. 
•	Supervised the preparation of the Environmental Management Framework and Resettlement Framework under REP 2.
•	Was involved in the design and implementation of the "Power to the Poor" program, which aims at helping villagers that cannot afford the cost of connecting their house to the electricity grid. 
•	Was involved in the development of surveys to assess project impact on the socio-economic position of the rural poor. 

Cambodia Rural Electrification and Transmission Project (RETP)
•	Supervised the government's compliance with safeguard requirements.
•	Developed a capacity building program for safeguards staff of Electricité de Cambodge.

Solomon Islands Sustainable Energy Project (SISEP):
•	Prepared a discussion paper on recommended arrangements for land acquisition, and was involved in consultations with indigenous communities.
•	Supervised the preparation of the Environmental and Social Framework.
•	Designed a project component for community-based electrification in remote communities, using coconut oil.

Pacific Islands: Powering the Pacific
•	Conducted preparatory conversations with government officials in the Solomon Islands, Tonga and Vanuatu, and Samoa, to discuss potential safeguard issues.', 'title': 'Social and Environment Associate', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 166426, 'name': 'The World Bank', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHaSQcYJGhexg/company-logo_400_400/0/1519881276203?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=TPUIWx_PoFroIy035knB9V2fYFknL5M2HtHZp7Okqrs', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-world-bank/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'company': 'The World Bank', 'description': "Environmental Department, Biodiversity Team

Supervised the preparation and implementation of conservation projects under the direction of the Lead Biodiversity Specialist. My main responsibility was with the Critical Ecosystem Partnership Fund (CEPF).

CEPF: global program that builds the capacity of local NGOs, communities, and others for sustainability in the world's biodiversity hotspots. 
•	Supervised project implementation, including on social safeguards.
•	Prepared parts of the Implementation Completion Report. 
•	Participated in CEPF Technical Working Groups and Secretariat meetings.
•	Participated in the preparation of the phase 2 documentation, including on social safeguard requirements, and in the appraisal and negotiation meetings.

Other projects
Local Language Field Guides Trust Funds: program under which more than 100 field guides are published. 
•	Supervised the development of the field guides by the grantees.
•	Formulated new grant agreements and ToRs, and Trust Fund evaluation reports.

Youth Innovation Fund (YIF) Projects: project design competition for young staff.
•	Was a two time winner of the YIF competition, and obtained financing for two projects, which I designed and supervised: 
-	Project in Indonesia to improve conservation of unique ecosytems on Sangihe Island. The project helped a high school to provide environmental education, and serve initiate sustainable business development (ecotourism and nutmegg syrup). 
-	Project in DRC to help young, war affected women to reintegrate in society through vocational education. 

Global Invasive Species Program (GISP): program aiming at minimizing the spread and impact of invasive alien species.
•	Prepared of ToRs for new grant agreements.
•	Participated in Secretariat meetings.

World Bank-WWF Alliance Central Africa Forest Indigenous People International Forum
•	Identified participants, and selected case studies for the forum, and participated in meetings.", 'title': 'Social and Environment Associate', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 13445, 'name': 'SNV Netherlands Development Organisation', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQG1LfSno0rbaQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519855938169?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=TBbS4NClpdaRfjt7Z9RTCsqYYxB117B_TQtPGUz7NMk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/snv/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'company': 'SNV', 'description': 'Assessed the factors which impact the socio-economic position of women in the Cameronian forest area, and how the activities of local organisations and of SNV influence.
